conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height and thickness, multiple wall faces are visible, rooms read as volumetric spaces, and the view is clearly angled/isometric with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D massing with readable wall volumes and clean cutaway; minor simplification of corner/partition detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment shell and main zones (two bedrooms + central living/dining) roughly match, but several plan-specific spaces/openings appear missing or reconfigured (notably decks/balconies and service/utility; bathroom count/placement not fully faithful). Doors/windows are simplified and do not consistently align with the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Bedrooms and dining are furnished; kitchen/bath elements are present but simplified and not fully consistent with the 2D layout (fixture placement/details reduced).

visual_clarity.notes: Clear separation of walls/floors with good visibility; coherent materials and clean background. Some openings/windows are not clearly represented.

detected_errors.description: Plan-specific ancillary spaces (decks/balconies and utility/service area) are not clearly modeled or are effectively absent in the 3D render.
Internal partitioning and room boundary placements are simplified/shifted versus the 2D plan, reducing layout fidelity (especially around kitchen/foyer/bath core).
Doors/windows/openings are simplified; several do not appear on the correct walls or with correct proportions relative to the 2D plan.
Furniture/fixtures are generic and some placements do not clearly confirm the same room identities as the 2D plan.

summary: A genuine and readable 3D cutaway is produced, but several key plan spaces and opening placements are simplified or missing, limiting strict geometric fidelity to the 2D floor plan.
